content: I had the same issue with read messages not displaying. It was due to a glitch in the app’s sync feature. I fixed it by clearing the cache and restarting the app. If that does not work, try checking your notification settings or reinstalling the app!
creator: rke35511

content:
Thunderbird is advising you that the Security for the site is unverified and needs updating. You can allow an exception so that Thunderbird accesses the site but that is never advisable.

Optusnet has been throwing up problems with TB in the past couple of weeks. A link to the Optus help sheet is here - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1486768. I note that the TB settings there posted are different to the ones being used.
creator: frisée

content: You haven't stated which server the problem is with - or whether it's both. You could remove the password from one server and then log in to reset it. Worth a go but not guaranteed to work.
creator: frisée

content: Welke code bedoelt u? Normaal gezien zou installatie zonder problemen moeten verlopen.

content:
TB often defines what a 'junk' message is by a mark on the incoming email put there by the server through which it comes. So, that's a possibility...

...however, you didn't mention a filter. Have you set up a filter for that particular email address?

A filter can be set up by accessing the filter interface at Hamburger (top right)/Tools/Message Filters. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters
creator: frisée

content:
frisée said
TB often defines what a 'junk' message is by a mark on the incoming email put there by the server through which it comes. So, that's a possibility... ...however, you didn't mention a filter. Have you set up a filter for that particular email address? A filter can be set up by accessing the filter interface at Hamburger (top right)/Tools/Message Filters. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters

Thank you for the reply. As I have mentioned, the email comes internally and in the web UI on gmail it is marked "This message was not sent to Spam based on your organization's settings." So the issue is stricly TB.

I don't have a filter, but if the junk filter works properly it shouldn't be necessary. What could be the reason for a message to go in the junk if the sender is in my address book?
creator: firezombie

content: Does the message become marked as Junk in addition to being moved to the Junk folder or is it just being moved there but not marked as Junk? Because if it's not being marked as Junk, my guess would be that it's being moved there by a normal filter, not by the Junk filter. What happens if you disable the Junk filter?
creator: DavidGG

content:
Dipende da cosa hai attivato. Se si tratta dell’autenticazione a 2 fattori, allora devi:

  1. creare una password specifica per Thunderbird -> https://guide.pec.it/gestione-account-pec/password/programmi-di-posta/come-generarla.aspx
  2. Inserire questa nuova password in Thunderbird
